original_data.question: A 14-year-old girl presents with sudden drooping of the right side of her face with drooling and excessive tearing. The patient’s mother says that the patient was recently in northern Maine and spent most of her time during the trip outdoors. Physical examination reveals a slight asymmetry of the facial muscles with an inability to whistle or close the right eye. A circular red rash with central clearing is present on the trunk. There is also decreased taste sensation. Which of the following most likely transmitted the organism responsible for this patient’s illness?

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The anterior portion of the head that includes the skin, muscles, and structures of the forehead, eyes, nose, mouth, cheeks, and jaw.
Saliva spilling out of the mouth.
Beyond normal limits; unrestrained.
The fluid secreted by the lacrimal glands. This fluid moistens the CONJUNCTIVA and CORNEA.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
Female parents, human or animal.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
One of the four primary cardinal directions. It is at 0 degree on a compass card. It is the direction to the left of sunrise.
A state bounded on the east by the Atlantic Ocean, on the north by Canada, and on the south and west by New Hampshire.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)

A synthetic decapeptide agonist analog of luteinizing hormone releasing hormone (LHRH). Possessing greater potency than endogenous LHRH, triptorelin reversibly represses gonadotropin secretion. After chronic, continuous administration, this agent effects sustained decreases in LH and FSH production and testicular and ovarian steroidogenesis. Serum testosterone concentrations may fall to levels typically observed in surgically castrated men. (NCI04)
Any area outside a building or shelter.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
A finding of a lack of symmetry between two or more bilaterally aligned structures.
Muscles of facial expression or mimetic muscles that include the numerous muscles supplied by the facial nerve that are attached to and move the skin of the face. (From Stedman, 25th ed)
Inadequate personal response to problems or difficulties
The eye positioned in the right orbit.
A ring-shaped structure with every point equidistant from the center.
A subjective response indicating that something is or has decreased.
The ability to detect chemicals through gustatory receptors in the mouth, including those on the TONGUE; the PALATE; the PHARYNX; and the EPIGLOTTIS.

The process in which specialized SENSORY RECEPTOR CELLS transduce peripheral stimuli (physical or chemical) into NERVE IMPULSES which are then transmitted to the various sensory centers in the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM.
The transmission of infectious disease or pathogens. When transmission is within the same species, the mode can be horizontal or vertical (INFECTIOUS DISEASE TRANSMISSION, VERTICAL).
A living entity.
A state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.
